it.polimi.se2019.server.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.commons.utility.Observable<MVEvent>
      • it.polimi.se2019.server.model.Game

  • public class Game
extends Observable<MVEvent>
    This class communicates with the virtual view. It holds all of the main data of the current game as the chosen map configuration, the number of skulls of the match, whether final frenzy is activated, the killshot track on which all the deaths are stored, The current players, their colours and usernames and the turn memory.

                                boolean overkill)

        Parameters:

        overkill - whether the killer overkilled.

      • allowedMovements

        public void allowedMovements(String username,
                             String target,
                             int radius)
        calculates the movements a player is allowed to perform.
        Parameters:
        username - the user deciding the moves.
        target - the target moved, can be the first username as well.
        radius - the maximum distance.

      • frenzyUpdatePlayerStatus

        public void frenzyUpdatePlayerStatus(Player killer)
        All players without any damage change their boards to final frenzy boards. final frenzy players get a different set of moves based on their position in the current.
        Parameters:
        killer -

      • getMapConfigs

        public List<String> getMapConfigs()
        returns the map configurations generated through the JSON files.
        Returns:
        the list of names of the available map configurations.

      • unloadedWeapons

        public void unloadedWeapons(String username)
        returns the weapons owned that are not loaded in order to reload them.
        Parameters:
        username - the user whose weapons are to be reloaded.

      • usablePowerUps

        public void usablePowerUps(String powerUpType,
                           boolean costs,
                           Player currentPlayer)
        Calculates which power ups can be used given their constraint.
        Parameters:
        powerUpType - the constraint that is being considered (eg: during the player's turn, while attacking, while beinng attacked).
        costs - whether the usage would cost.
        currentPlayer - the player whose power ups are being evaluated.
